newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Aramco improves offer for Petrogal stake - papers.
newsitem.headline: Aramco improves offer for Petrogal stake - papers.

text.p: Saudi Aramco, which has held talks in recent months to buy a stake in Portuguese state oil company Petrogal, has boosted its offer, paving the way for a possible outline agreement by end-June, Lisbon newspapers reported.

Diario Economico said it had learned that Saudi Aramco had raised its offer following a revaluation of Petrogal by J.P.Morgan based on its 1996 accounts, which valued the Portuguese oil company at at least 230 billion escudos.
Newspapers did not give details of the offer.
Under-Secretary for Energy Jose Penedos told Diario Economico: "Conditions have been created to reach an outline agreement by the end of June."
Petrogal shareholders were expected to meet on Thursday to consider Saudi Aramco's offer.
Diario Economico and Diario de Noticias said that the revaluation of Petrogal did not account for a recent substantial offshore oil find in northern Angola by a consortium that includes Petrogal.
Sources involved in the talks have said that Saudi Aramco could take a stake of around 35 percent in Petrogal.
A private shareholders' group Petrocontrol would hold another 35 percent, the state 10 percent, and 20 percent would be floated on Lisbon bourse.
Government officials were not immediately available to comment on the newspaper report.
